data.title: Get Current Census Data for Dodge Center, MN
data.meta_description: Need Dodge Center demographics? Get current population, race, age, income & poverty statistics for Dodge Center, MN from the US Census Bureau.
data.text:
Sources: United States Census Bureau. 2022 American Community Survey 5-Year Estimates. U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey Office. Web. 7 December 2023.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2020 to July 1, 2023. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2024. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2010 to July 1, 2019. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2021. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. "P2 Hispanic or Latino, and Not Hispanic or Latino by Race." 2020 Census State Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary File. U.S. Census Bureau, 2020 Census. Web. 12 August 2021. https://www.census.gov/.

Check out our FAQs for more details.

Population

With 2,928 people, Dodge Center is the 215th most populated city in the state of Minnesota out of 913 cities. But watch out, Dodge Center, because Greenfield with 2,865 people and Mountain Iron with 2,854 people are right behind you.

Race & Ethnicity

The largest Dodge Center racial/ethnic groups are White (81.0%) followed by Hispanic (15.8%) and Asian (1.7%).

Median Income

In 2022, the median household income of Dodge Center households was $76,058. Dodge Center households made slightly more than Lexington households ($76,047), St. Rosa households ($75,833), and Rothsay households ($75,833) . However, 4.1% of Dodge Center families live in poverty.

Median Age

The median age for Dodge Center residents is 36.6 years young.
